definition: to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

sentences.english: They, at least, should be first in line among the pre-bankruptcy creditors to be paid.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行至少可以作为破产前债权人，得到优先赔付。

sentences.english: Cargo insurance does not cover theft or dishonesty by the party that is insured.
sentences.chinese: 若投保方偷窃或骗保，货物保险不会赔付。

sentences.english: This is a statement of loss and you should indemnify us $2, 450.
sentences.chinese: 这是损失清单一张，你方应赔付我方2450美元。

sentences.english: The person who caused the traffic accident paid the victim in full.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故中肇事方全额赔付了受害者。

sentences.english: I love the bloke. I want to pay out on him.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢这家伙，也愿意向下注者赔付。

sentences.english: If premium rates fall, loss ratios increase, over time.
sentences.chinese: 如果费率下降，赔付率亦会随着时间的推移而上升。

sentences.english: Claims payable without deduction new for old.
sentences.chinese: 应赔付的赔偿不作以新换旧的扣减。

definition: to settle a claim/claims settlement/payment of claims
to get out of trouble/to escape from danger/a danger appears/threatened by danger
to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
